column4: msg nickserv identify prettyis1
rying to ssh into a box and I'm getting
is sshd running on the target box?
whats the command to check that?
on the target machine, try "netstat -antu | grep 22"
ok one minute
when we tried to start sshd it returned "failed"
and if you try starting the daemon manually? /usr/bin/sshd or whatever
/usr/sbin/sshd
would i type "/usr/sbin/sshd start"?
no, just /usr/sbin/sshd
sudo /usr/sbin/sshd, actually
the computer is in different room, i will try that
when we did /usr/sbin/sshd it said "execution requires an absolute path"
yuo could type the exact command line you used?
could you, rather
type what?
so what command should i type my friend?
the exact command you used to start the ssh daemon
we figured it out,  a bunch of permissions were changed but thanks for the help
